cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (35 mph) – below SSHS hurricane scale
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast (Florida Panhandle/Big Bend area) and then inland across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle – near or east of Apalachicola

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from east of the Ochlockonee River, FL to Yankeetown, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River and from the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward through the Florida Big Bend; storm-surge watch Indian Pass to Clearwater Beach, FL
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – isolated totals up to 5 inches possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No – surge of 1-2 ft possible, but >3 ft unlikely south of Clearwater
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with sustained 20-30 mph and occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (mainly Friday afternoon–night)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft above normal tides, especially during Friday night high tide; coastal flooding of low-lying areas possible
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated 5 inch pockets, leading to localized ponding and brief freshwater flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and squally bands may disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements
